Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the statement that moving to a Medicare for All system could save the system trillions over an extended period of time.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it does not provide a clear explanation or analysis of how exactly the savings would be achieved in a Medicare for All system.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the report mentioned supports the idea that a Medicare for All system could save trillions, without considering any potential limitations or counterarguments.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations of the report mentioned, as both supporters and critics of Medicare for All have used different aspects of the report to support their arguments.
